text: Nationalism is an infantile disease. It is the measles of mankind.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Patriot: the person who can holler the loudest without knowing what he is hollering about.
author: Mark Twain

text: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
author: Oscar Wilde
